data.text: It's personal preference! I wear hiking shorts and a pair of merino underwear, as did my partner while riding in Baja for 35ish days where we only did laundry once. You'll be sore the first three days, but after that, I'd rather have the breathability. I got a TERRIBLE yeast infection from re wearing a chamois for long sweaty days on previous trip. But if it's a shorter trip I can see how some would prefer a cham, but to me personally it's impractical for any trip longer than a night or two.

data.text: I use a large SMP touring saddle and make sure my saddle is angled forward enough that my spine can be straight or even a little arched back. This helps with back pain. I prefer riding single track so standing up on the pedals encourages good blood flow. A saddle is highly personal so try a few from shops that are fine with you returning them if they're not a good fit. Some people will try to convince you that there is a best seat but your ass won't lie to you.
